questions.question: Rembrandt lighting involves a single light source positioned at a _____________ angle to the subject.
What is the most recognizable feature of Rembrandt lighting on the subject's face?
options: A. A shadow across both eyes
B. A triangle or diamond of light under one eye
C. A bright light evenly covering both sides of the face
D. A circle of light around the forehead

questions.question: Rembrandt lighting is always applied dramatically and never subtly.
options: True
False

questions.question: Chiaroscuro is a lighting technique that uses strong contrast between light and dark to create dramatic effects.
options: True
False

questions.question: Chiaroscuro comes from an Italian word meaning _____________.
Which of the following statements best explains why Caravaggio's chiaroscuro technique is considered emotionally powerful?
options: A. It uses soft transitions and pastel colors for a calming effect.
B. It relies on dramatic contrasts between light and dark to emphasize narrative and emotion.
C. It avoids strong shadows in favor of overall brightness.
D. It focuses only on accurate anatomical drawing without light effects

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Monet's approach to light?
options: A. He used strong contrasts between light and dark for drama
B. He painted night scenes only with artificial light
C. He observed how natural light changed colors throughout the day
D. He avoided shadows to keep his palette flat

questions.question: Monet often painted the same subject multiple times under different _____________ conditions to study light and color.
Monet's technique relied heavily on artificial studio lighting.
options: True
False

questions.question: What is Gerard van Honthorst best known for in terms of lighting?
options: A. Using soft natural daylight only
B. Using only moonlight in his landscapes
C. Using dramatic candlelight in indoor scenes
D. Painting only outdoor sunlit portraits

questions.question: Gerard van Honthorst often used a single _____________ as the main source of light in his night scenes.
Gerard van Honthorst became known as 'Gerard of the night' because he painted glowing landscapes under the moon.
options: True
False

5.title: Quiz Five: Leonardo da Vinci Light & Shade

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Leonardo's use of Sfumato?
options: A. Harsh shadows to emphasize volume
B. Strong spotlight on the subject
C. Soft, hazy blending of tones to avoid hard edges
D. Flat light with no visible transition

questions.question: Leonardo used a soft glow behind the subject to highlight edges. This is called _____________ lighting.
Leonardo da Vinci only used one style of lighting throughout his career.
options: True
False
